intro: Pilosella lygaea, commonly known as the lygaea hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are hairy and alternate, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Pilosella lygaea is often found in open habitats and can spread through both seeds and vegetative means.
